body.p:
Henry Co Ky March 20" 1865
To his Excellency
Thos E Bramlett
Governor of Ky

The undersigned would respectfully State, that it is represented to us that there are at this time sixty five (65) reenlisted men formerly belonging to the thirteenth (13") Ky Regt now on detatched duty at Barracks No 1 Louisville Ky, the number entitles them to a captain and as your excellency will most likely be called on to appoint a corps of commanderofficirs for them, we take pleasure in recommending our young County man Serg W. W. Rowlett for the office of Captain, this young man was one of the first to volunteer at Camp Joe Holt, and was transferred from Gen Rousseaus Comnd to the 2nd Ky Cav and was present and participated in the battles of Chilo -- Stone River, Perryville Chickamauga, also in series of battles resulting in the Capture Atlanta, and reenlisted in Feby 1864, and returned for the first time on a short furlough

Sergt Rowlett has for some months been on detached duty
at Louisville Ky -- We know him to be eminently qualified to take Command of a Company not only from his experience in the army on the field, but also from his education and high moral qualities

E, L. Long,, late
Assit Surgeon 6 Ky Inft,
Joel. H Clark
M B Pearce. Clerk
Henry County Court
W. J. Brewer Sheriff. H. co
Geo. L. Humolin Clerk
Henry Circuit Court
J N Webb Rep Henry Co
Jno, C. Moufort Judge of Henry county court
S. W Hunt Surveyor H. County

13
Henry Co. Ky
Mar. 20. 1865
Long E. L.
Late Asst. Surg. 6" Ky Infy
And others --
Rowlett. W.W
Recommend Sgt. W. W. Rowlett for captaincy of the Detachment of 13" Ky (65 re-enlisted men) now on duty at Barracks No. 1. Louisville Ky --

L B No 11 -- 1865 P. 103
Recd A. G. O. Ky 21 Mar. 1865
